abstract: California state auditor finds University of California undermined state residents by admitting non-resident students who were less qualified than in-state students; Univ of Calif president Janet Napolitano calls report unfair, saying out-of-state tuition, which is higher, helps keep doors open as state assistance drops.
lead_paragraph: California’s auditor said that the University of California had undermined residents by admitting a growing number of nonresident students, some of whom were less qualified than in-state students.

headline.main: California: Audit of University Finds In-State Students Are Shortchanged
headline.print_headline: California: Audit of University Finds In-State Students Are Shortchanged

snippet: California’s auditor said that the University of California had undermined residents by admitting a growing number of nonresident students, some of whom were less qualified than in-state students.
